thread.title: College visits can veer away from just academics
thread.title_full: College visits can veer away from just academics

title: College visits can veer away from just academics
text:
College visits can veer away from just academics Travel By Lynn O'Rourke Hayes DALLAS MORNING NEWS • Sunday August 9, 2015 5:00 AM 
Who says homework can’t be fun? College visits can make for a great getaway. 
• Minneapolis: Check out the University of Minnesota and stay at the Commons Hotel. 
At the self-described “industrial schoolhouse chic” establishment, hotel guests can call upon the resident “book butler” to deliver your favorite read or they can hop aboard the light rail, just paces from the front door, and visit Target Field, the vibrant riverfront area or the Mall of America. 
Visit www.commonshotel.com 
• Madison, Wis.: In Madison, book the Badger Pride package and receive a University of Wisconsin T-shirt, hat, university newspaper and a campus map. Some packages include an extra-absorbent box of tissues as a nod to dropping off children for their freshman year. 
Visit www.graduatehotels.com 
• Chapel Hill, N.C.: Families considering Duke University or the University of North Carolina might consider the Siena Hotel. 
Families can sink into an Italian frame of mind when not pondering academic matters. 
The Siena provides children with a memorable turn-down-the-covers experience, complete with child-sized robes, a good-night glow stick and chocolates. Visit www.sienahotel.com 
• Oxford, England: Even if your family member won’t be enrolling, you’ll all have the option to spend the night in a historic Oxford college dorm room. 
Just 60 miles from London, the hallowed institution has educated prime ministers, kings and Nobel Prize winners. Dine in the Hogwarts-style hall, wander through the lush gardens and admire the architecture. 
Visit www.oxfordcityguide.com 
• Flagstaff, Ariz.: Families visiting Northern Arizona University can check into an affordable yurt or cabin at the Nordic Center’s Off Grid Getaways headquarters. 
Just 60 miles from Grand Canyon National Park, your clan can celebrate the collegiate rite of passage by hiking or mountain biking in the Coconino National Forest, dining in town along the iconic Route 66 and visiting local museums.
